lead_paragraph: GILBERT--Edward M.,dubbed the "Boy Wonder of Wall Street" in the 1950's, died peacefully at his home in Santa Fe, New Mexico on Wednesday, December 23, 2015. He was five days short of his 93rd birthday. Eddie lived a unique and exceptional life. As a young man, Eddie fought bravely in World War II and received a Purple Heart and a Bronze Star. He had many achievements. He was a competitive springboard diver and in 1942 made the U.S. Open at Forest Hills; he had a world-renowned stamp collection and gave generously to many causes in Santa Fe. In 1992, Eddie co-founded BGK Group, a highly successful commercial real estate company headquartered in Santa Fe. Under Eddie's leadership the company acquired a large national portfolio as well as premier buildings in New Mexico, Texas and elsewhere. By 2010, when New York-based Rosemont Real Estate acquired part ownership of BGK, Gilbert's company was the largest holder of commercial real estate in New Mexico, owning properties in 28 states. He was "larger than life" say his children. He will be greatly missed. He is survived by his wife Peaches, seven children, Robin, Alexandra (Ronald), Dominique, Nina, Sasha, Beatrice and Zoe and three grandchildren, Brooke, Ross and Yeabsira. 1/3
